channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Cancer drugs, foreign education, alcohol… What becomes cheaper and costlier after Budget 2026?
Union Budget 2026: What is the rare earth corridor? Why is India betting big on it now?
No income tax changes, capex up, NRIs gain… The big takeaways from Union Budget 2026
Quicksplained: Why cigarettes, pan masala get more expensive even before Budget announcement
This Week in Explainers: What happens if the US attacks Iran?
This Budget, Nirmala Sitharaman’s focus will be on Part B. Here’s what to expect
How Pakistan’s selective blindness has turned into a security nightmare
item.description: Pakistan still treats Islamist terrorism as a security issue rather than an ideological one, with little effort to dismantle radicalisation networks or challenge extremist narratives. At the same time, the Baloch insurgency—driven by political exclusion, economic marginalisation, and coercive governance—is addressed almost solely through force

item.title: From scarcity to strategic advantage: India’s leap forward in shaping the global supply chain for critical minerals
item.description: India’s strategy signals a shift from transactional resource acquisition to long-term supply-chain partnerships. These partnerships increasingly emphasise sustainability, value addition, and shared development outcomes, aligning Indian economic interests with broader global governance norms

item.title: Old ties, new imperatives: How India-Arab relations are pivotal to responsible multipolarity
item.description: India’s deepening engagement with the League of Arab States reflects a strategically calibrated partnership spanning defence, trade, connectivity, diaspora ties and cultural diplomacy in a multipolar world

item.title: Turning rhetoric into reality: Sergio Gor’s defining challenge as US envoy
item.description: Sergio Gor’s key task is rebuilding trust and translating his rhetoric into action in strained bilateral relations

item.title: Budget 2026: Hopes are high, but hard choices have to be made
item.description: Union Budget 2026 is expected to act as a unifying signal, aligning industrial policy with trade strategy, climate commitments with fiscal planning, and digital public infrastructure with social inclusion goals. It can reinforce confidence that India’s growth is not accidental or cyclical but designed

item.title: The EU-India FTA opens doors for textiles, but compliance could be the key
item.description: The India–EU free trade pact will be judged not only by tariff lines and market size but by whether India’s textile supply chains can show cleaner water, safer work and lower emissions at scale
